 float standardYVelocityRight
          For each screen, the doll can move on a flat line, or a little bit inclined line; this is set in database.
 float staticCenterX
          x position of doll image centre from its own left side (not from left side of camera or background).

Constructor Summary
Doll(DatabaseHandler dbh, Context context, org.anddev.andengine.engine.Engine engine, org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene scene)
          Loads images and creates every sprites, attach them to the AndEngine scene, register touch areas and set ZIndexes.
 
Method Summary
 void changeSkin(int skinId)
          Changes the aspect of the doll (walking and idle).
 int getScreen()
          Finds in which screen doll is in.
 int[] getStartingPosition()
          Finds where the doll should start on an defined screen.
 void getYVelocity(int screenId)
          Get y velocity from database: doll can move on a flat line or on an inclined line, depending on the screen.
 void move(int status, float touchedX)
          Launches doll sprite animation and move of doll until a point or item/area, etc...
 void sayNo()
          Animates idle animation (= doll says no).
 void setVisible(boolean choice)
          Hides or displays walking skin and idle skin of doll, when an animation is running and doll disappears somewhere.
 void stop()
          Changes doll sprite from walking skin to idle and stop animation playing and moving.

public org.anddev.andengine.engine.handler.physics.PhysicsHandler ph

standardYVelocityRight

public float standardYVelocityRight
For each screen, the doll can move on a flat line, or a little bit inclined line; this is set in database.

standardYVelocityLeft

public float standardYVelocityLeft
Left velocity is negative of right velocity. Don't ask me why there are 2 variables. Found it clearer, I guess.

YVelocity

public float YVelocity
Used if the velocity is changed in relation to standard doll velocity in the screen; for animation purpose.

staticCenterX

public float staticCenterX
x position of doll image centre from its own left side (not from left side of camera or background).

public int walkDirection

public boolean isChased

Constructor Detail

Doll

public Doll(DatabaseHandler dbh,
            Context context,
            org.anddev.andengine.engine.Engine engine,
            org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene scene)
Loads images and creates every sprites, attach them to the AndEngine scene, register touch areas and set ZIndexes.

Parameters:
dbh - database handler is stored for upcoming database calls
context - Android context, to retrieve files
engine - AndEngine engine, to load textures
scene - AndEngine scene, to attach sprites to scene and register touch areas
Method Detail

move

public void move(int status,
                 float touchedX)
Launches doll sprite animation and move of doll until a point or item/area, etc...

Parameters:
status - is it normal playing or is an animation running ? (in this case, y velocity is changed)
touchedX - x position the doll must move until (if not stopped by boundaries)

stop

public void stop()
Changes doll sprite from walking skin to idle and stop animation playing and moving.

sayNo

public void sayNo()
Animates idle animation (= doll says no).

getYVelocity

public void getYVelocity(int screenId)
Get y velocity from database: doll can move on a flat line or on an inclined line, depending on the screen.

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean choice)
Hides or displays walking skin and idle skin of doll, when an animation is running and doll disappears somewhere.

getScreen

public int getScreen()
Finds in which screen doll is in.

getStartingPosition

public int[] getStartingPosition()
Finds where the doll should start on an defined screen.

changeSkin

public void changeSkin(int skinId)
Changes the aspect of the doll (walking and idle).
